column4: quick question:  how do I use grep to search all files in a directory and all of its subdirectories for a string?
oh, I just remembered a question that's been nagging me
In other distros I've used, switching runlevels will stop X from respawning.  Why doesn't this work in ubuntu?
because for some stupid reason gdm is in levels 2 AND 3
I don't want to be in runlevel 1
I would suggest taking it out of 2 and making 3 the default (if it isn't already)
so, if I went to runlevel four or five that would kill X?
it'll show you which levels 's'tart gdm, and which 'k'ill it
I installed the system using the kubuntu cd, and then became enamored by xfce
it seems that (k)ubuntu just isn't meant to be used from the console.  why else put gdm in both levels 2 and 3
